scenicAreas.name: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
scenicAreas.description: 46 High Peaks • alpine zones • Avalanche Pass, Marcy, Gothics

scenicAreas.name: Lake George & Pharaoh Lake Wilderness
scenicAreas.description: Ridge walks • island views • Tongue Mountain Range

scenicAreas.name: Catskills (Slide, Hunter, Kaaterskill)
scenicAreas.description: Classic Northeast peaks • Spruce-fir summits • waterfalls

scenicAreas.name: Shawangunks / Minnewaska & Mohonk Preserve
scenicAreas.description: Sky lakes • white cliffs • carriage roads & scrambles

scenicAreas.name: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
scenicAreas.description: River panoramas • steep but short classics • train-access options

scenicAreas.name: Harriman–Bear Mountain State Parks
scenicAreas.description: Hundreds of miles of trails • lakes • Appalachian Trail segments

scenicAreas.name: Finger Lakes Gorges (Ithaca area)
scenicAreas.description: Stone-cut gorges • rim trails • waterfalls (Treman, Buttermilk, Taughannock)

scenicAreas.name: Watkins Glen & Surrounds
scenicAreas.description: Iconic gorge • stairways & bridges • Seneca Lake views

scenicAreas.name: Letchworth State Park (Genesee River Gorge)
scenicAreas.description: 'Grand Canyon of the East' • three major falls • rim trails

scenicAreas.name: Allegany State Park (Southern Tier)
scenicAreas.description: Remote feel • rolling ridges • long multi-hour loops

scenicAreas.name: Niagara Gorge (NY side)
scenicAreas.description: Dramatic river gorge • whirlpool rapids • rim & gorge trails

scenicAreas.name: Taconic Range / Harlem Valley (incl. Bash Bish area)
scenicAreas.description: Ridgetop views • state-line loop options • Bash Bish Falls nearby

scenicAreas.name: Long Island North & South Fork highlights (Montauk bluffs)
scenicAreas.description: Coastal bluffs • dune walks • lighthouse views • shoulder-season gems

scenicAreas.name: Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve (Lloyd Neck)
scenicAreas.description: Easy coastal loops • meadow & shoreline scenery • family friendly

cities.name: Lake Placid
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Olympic village in the heart of the Adirondacks. Home to two Winter Olympics (1932, 1980) with world-class skiing, hiking, and lake activities. Features Mirror Lake, Whiteface Mountain, and the Olympic Center.

cities.name: Saranac Lake
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Historic Adirondack village known for its Victorian architecture, vibrant arts scene, and the famous Winter Carnival with ice palace. Gateway to the Saranac Lakes chain and numerous hiking trails.

cities.name: Tupper Lake
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Gateway to the western Adirondacks with excellent fishing, boating, and hiking. Home to the Wild Center natural history museum and the Adirondack Sky Center observatory.

cities.name: Keene
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Small mountain town surrounded by the High Peaks. Perfect base for hiking the 46 High Peaks, with access to Cascade, Porter, and other popular trailheads.

cities.name: Keene Valley
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Historic trailhead village for the High Peaks. Starting point for hikes to Giant Mountain, Rocky Peak Ridge, and the famous Ausable Club trails.

cities.name: Wilmington
cities.scenicArea: Adirondack High Peaks (Keene/Keene Valley, Lake Placid)
cities.description: Mountain town with Whiteface Mountain ski resort and the Whiteface Veterans Memorial Highway. Gateway to the High Peaks with excellent hiking and skiing.

cities.name: Lake George
cities.description: The 'Queen of American Lakes' with crystal-clear waters and 32 miles of shoreline. Popular for boating, fishing, and lake cruises. Historic village with shops, restaurants, and family attractions.

cities.name: Glens Falls
cities.description: Historic mill city on the Hudson River. Home to the Hyde Collection art museum, Cooper's Cave, and the Charles R. Wood Theater. Gateway to Lake George and the Adirondacks.

cities.name: Hudson Falls
cities.description: Village on the Hudson River with historic charm and outdoor recreation. Features the Feeder Canal Trail, Derby Park, and proximity to Lake George attractions.

cities.name: Saratoga Springs
cities.description: Historic spa city famous for mineral springs, horse racing at Saratoga Race Course, and the Saratoga Performing Arts Center. Elegant Victorian architecture and vibrant downtown.

cities.name: North Creek
cities.description: Mountain village gateway to Gore Mountain ski resort and the Upper Hudson River. Historic railroad depot and access to whitewater rafting and hiking trails.

cities.name: Schenectady
cities.description: Historic 'Electric City' with rich industrial heritage. Home to Union College, Proctors Theatre, and the Stockade Historic District. Gateway to the Adirondacks and Mohawk Valley.

cities.name: Bolton
cities.description: Lakefront town on Lake George with beautiful beaches, marinas, and lake access. Popular for boating, fishing, and water sports with scenic mountain views.

cities.name: Ticonderoga
cities.description: Historic town between Lake George and Lake Champlain. Home to Fort Ticonderoga, a key Revolutionary War site, with beautiful lake views and hiking trails.

cities.name: Hunter
cities.description: Mountain town home to Hunter Mountain ski resort and the Hunter Mountain Festival Grounds. Access to hiking trails including Hunter Mountain Fire Tower and the Devil's Path.

cities.name: Tannersville
cities.description: Charming mountain village known for its colorful 'painted ladies' Victorian houses. Gateway to Kaaterskill Falls and numerous hiking trails in the Catskills.

cities.name: Woodstock
cities.description: Legendary arts and music town that inspired the 1969 festival. Vibrant community with galleries, music venues, and outdoor recreation. Gateway to Overlook Mountain and the Catskills.

cities.name: Kingston
cities.description: New York's first capital with rich colonial history. Features the Stockade Historic District, Rondout waterfront, and vibrant arts scene. Gateway to the Catskills and Hudson River.

cities.name: Phoenicia
cities.description: Tiny mountain hamlet known for tubing on the Esopus Creek and the Phoenicia Diner. Access to Slide Mountain and the Devil's Path hiking trails.

cities.name: Windham
cities.description: Mountain town with Windham Mountain ski resort and the Windham Path. Access to hiking trails including Windham High Peak and the Blackhead Range.

cities.name: New Paltz
cities.description: College town home to SUNY New Paltz with historic Huguenot Street. Gateway to the Shawangunk Mountains, Mohonk Preserve, and Minnewaska State Park for world-class rock climbing and hiking.

cities.name: Gardiner
cities.description: Rural town with rolling hills and farms. Gateway to the Shawangunk Mountains with access to hiking trails and scenic countryside views.

cities.name: Rosendale
cities.description: Historic town known for its cement industry heritage. Features the Rosendale Trestle, a popular rail trail, and access to the Shawangunk Mountains.

cities.name: Ellenville
cities.description: Mountain town with historic charm and outdoor recreation. Gateway to the Shawangunk Mountains with hiking trails and scenic valley views.

cities.name: Beacon
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Revitalized river town with the Dia:Beacon contemporary art museum, vibrant Main Street, and access to Breakneck Ridge hiking. Historic Mount Beacon and scenic Hudson River views.

cities.name: Poughkeepsie
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Historic Hudson River city home to Vassar College and the Walkway Over the Hudson. Features the Mid-Hudson Children's Museum and access to the Hudson Highlands hiking trails.

cities.name: Cold Spring
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Charming river village with historic Main Street, antique shops, and restaurants. Direct access to Breakneck Ridge and Bull Hill hiking trails with stunning Hudson River views.

cities.name: Cornwall-on-Hudson
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Charming river village with historic architecture and scenic Hudson River views. Access to Storm King Mountain and the Hudson Highlands hiking trails.

cities.name: Newburgh
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Historic river city with Washington's Headquarters and the Newburgh Waterfront. Access to Storm King Mountain and the Hudson Highlands with panoramic river views.

cities.name: Troy
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Historic industrial city home to RPI and Emma Willard School. Features the Troy Farmers Market, historic architecture, and proximity to the Hudson River and Adirondacks.

cities.name: White Plains
cities.scenicArea: Hudson Highlands (Breakneck, Storm King, Bull Hill)
cities.description: Westchester County's commercial hub with shopping, dining, and entertainment. Features the Westchester County Center and proximity to the Hudson Highlands and Hudson River.

cities.name: Harriman
cities.description: Village surrounded by Harriman State Park with extensive hiking trails and lakes. Gateway to the Appalachian Trail and outdoor recreation.

cities.name: Sloatsburg
cities.description: Historic village with charming Main Street and access to Harriman State Park. Gateway to hiking trails and outdoor recreation in the Ramapo Mountains.

cities.name: Monroe
cities.description: Growing town with historic charm and modern amenities. Gateway to Harriman State Park with access to hiking trails and outdoor recreation.

cities.name: Stony Point
cities.description: Historic town on the Hudson River with Stony Point Battlefield and lighthouse. Access to Harriman State Park and scenic river views.

cities.name: Fort Montgomery
cities.description: Historic village with Revolutionary War significance. Home to Fort Montgomery State Historic Site and access to Harriman State Park hiking trails.

cities.name: Ithaca
cities.description: College town home to Cornell University and Ithaca College. Famous for its gorges, waterfalls, and vibrant downtown. Gateway to Cayuga Lake and the Finger Lakes wine region.

cities.name: Skaneateles
cities.description: Charming village on pristine Skaneateles Lake with historic downtown, boutique shops, and restaurants. Known for its crystal-clear waters and scenic lake views.

cities.name: Canandaigua
cities.description: Historic town on Canandaigua Lake with the Sonnenberg Gardens, Finger Lakes Wine Center, and charming Main Street. Gateway to the Finger Lakes wine trail and outdoor recreation.

cities.name: Utica
cities.description: Historic Mohawk Valley city with the Munson-Williams-Proctor Arts Institute and Stanley Theater. Gateway to the Adirondacks and Finger Lakes with rich cultural heritage.

cities.name: Dryden
cities.description: Rural town with rolling hills and farms. Gateway to the Finger Lakes region with access to hiking trails and scenic countryside.

cities.name: Trumansburg
cities.description: Charming village near Taughannock Falls State Park. Gateway to the Finger Lakes with access to waterfalls and hiking trails.

cities.name: Watkins Glen
cities.description: Village famous for Watkins Glen State Park with its stunning gorge and waterfalls. Home to Watkins Glen International racetrack and gateway to Seneca Lake wine country.

cities.name: Montour Falls
cities.description: Village known for its beautiful waterfall and historic charm. Gateway to Watkins Glen State Park and the Finger Lakes wine region.

cities.name: Odessa
cities.description: Small village in the Finger Lakes region with rural charm. Gateway to Watkins Glen State Park and the surrounding wine country.

cities.name: Mount Morris
cities.description: Historic town near Letchworth State Park, the 'Grand Canyon of the East'. Gateway to the Genesee River Gorge with stunning waterfalls and hiking trails.

cities.name: Perry
cities.description: Village near Letchworth State Park with historic charm. Gateway to the Genesee River Gorge and the 'Grand Canyon of the East'.

cities.name: Castile
cities.description: Village near Letchworth State Park with rural charm. Gateway to the Genesee River Gorge and the 'Grand Canyon of the East'.

cities.name: Salamanca
cities.description: City on the Allegany Indian Reservation with rich Native American heritage. Gateway to Allegany State Park and the Southern Tier region.

cities.name: Binghamton
cities.description: Historic 'Carousel Capital of the World' with six antique carousels. Home to Binghamton University and the Roberson Museum. Gateway to the Southern Tier and Finger Lakes.

cities.name: Limestone
cities.description: Small village in the Southern Tier with rural charm. Gateway to Allegany State Park and the surrounding wilderness areas.

cities.name: Great Valley
cities.description: Village in the Southern Tier with rural charm and outdoor recreation. Gateway to Allegany State Park and the surrounding wilderness areas.

cities.name: Niagara Falls (NY)
cities.description: Home to the iconic Niagara Falls, one of the world's most famous natural wonders. Features Niagara Falls State Park, Maid of the Mist boat tours, and Cave of the Winds.

cities.name: Lewiston
cities.description: Historic village near Niagara Falls with charming Main Street and waterfront. Gateway to the Niagara Gorge and Niagara Falls attractions.

cities.name: Millerton
cities.scenicArea: Taconic Range / Harlem Valley (incl. Bash Bish area)
cities.description: Charming village in the Harlem Valley with historic charm. Gateway to the Taconic Range and Bash Bish Falls hiking trails.

cities.name: Amenia
cities.scenicArea: Taconic Range / Harlem Valley (incl. Bash Bish area)
cities.description: Village in the Harlem Valley with rural charm and historic architecture. Gateway to the Taconic Range and Bash Bish Falls hiking trails.

cities.name: Hillsdale
cities.scenicArea: Taconic Range / Harlem Valley (incl. Bash Bish area)
cities.description: Small village in the Harlem Valley with rural charm. Gateway to the Taconic Range and Bash Bish Falls hiking trails.

cities.name: Copake
cities.scenicArea: Taconic Range / Harlem Valley (incl. Bash Bish area)
cities.description: Village in the Harlem Valley with rural charm and historic architecture. Gateway to the Taconic Range and Bash Bish Falls hiking trails.

cities.name: Montauk
cities.scenicArea: Long Island North & South Fork highlights (Montauk bluffs)
cities.description: Easternmost point of Long Island with dramatic bluffs, Montauk Point Lighthouse, and world-class fishing. Popular beach destination with surfing, hiking, and scenic ocean views.

cities.name: Amagansett
cities.scenicArea: Long Island North & South Fork highlights (Montauk bluffs)
cities.description: Charming hamlet on the South Fork with beautiful beaches and historic charm. Gateway to Montauk and the Long Island coastal attractions.

cities.name: Lloyd Harbor
cities.scenicArea: Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve (Lloyd Neck)
cities.description: Exclusive village on the North Shore with beautiful waterfront properties. Gateway to Caumsett State Park and Long Island Sound recreation.

cities.name: Cold Spring Harbor
cities.scenicArea: Caumsett State Historic Park Preserve (Lloyd Neck)
cities.description: Historic village on the North Shore with charming harbor and historic architecture. Gateway to Caumsett State Park and Long Island Sound recreation.

cities.name: Livingston Manor
cities.description: Catskills fly-fishing hub on the Willowemoc with access to Beaverkill River; growing food and lodging scene.

cities.name: Roscoe
cities.description: "Trout Town USA" at the confluence of the Willowemoc and Beaverkill; classic Catskills angling destination.

cities.name: Hancock
cities.description: Gateway to Upper Delaware River system; renowned for drift-boat fly fishing on the East and West Branches.

cities.name: Pulaski
cities.description: Salmon River steelhead and salmon hotspot with year-round angling; access to Lake Ontario tribs.

legend.title: NY Hiking & Scenery — Highlight Guide
legend.note: Populations are approximate (2020–2023 ACS). Drive times assume Midtown origin, off‑peak. Train times are approximate and may vary.
